item.title: Report E-2025020401
item.description:
Report E-2025020401

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-28T00:58:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-18
  • City: MCKEES ROCKS
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: DAYTON FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 275-gallon poly IBC tote due to a forklift accident that resulted in the tote being punctured. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025020357
item.description:
Report E-2025020357

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-25
  • City: LEBANON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On February 25,2025, one (1) 5-gallon pail of paint was crushed and released approximately one (1) gallon of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to clean the trailer interior. All impacted materials and the damaged pail were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon and one (1) 30-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025020279
item.description:
Report E-2025020279

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-26T06:20:57+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-13
  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: While unloading freight from trailer material handler discovered a drum that had slid off of a pallet during transit and as a result a slat from the wooden pallet it was staged on slightly punctured the bottom of the drum consequently contributing to the unintentional release. Spilled material was neutralized and clean with absorbent and placed into a recovery container. The drum was repaired with drum putty and placed into a recovery container as well.

item.title: Report E-2025020264
item.description:
Report E-2025020264

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-25T00:50:48+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-02-20
  • City: WOODLAND
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-XLF contacted ERTS regarding a leaking 05-PAIL containing hazardous material, Pro Form Lacquer Thinner. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 2-gallon release onto the wooden trailer floor in a 2’x2’ area as a result of improper blocking and bracing. The contractor identified one leaking 05-PAIL and restacked the rest of the PAILS to ship on to the Consignee. One 30-gallon DF of waste was generated containing the damaged, leaking 05-PAIL of product. XPO will manage all waste created from the response. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were involved in this incident.

THE SPILL WAS CONTAINED TO THREE PACKAGES AND A SMALL AMOUNT ON THE FLOOR OF THE TRAILER. THE SPILL WAS ABSORBED WITH ZEP ZORB AND CONTAMINATED CARDBOARD WAS BAGGED.

  • Description: RESPONDER REPORTED TO DOOR. WEARING PROPER PPE USED THE DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEETS FOR CORROSIVE LIQUID. BOX WAS ON THE FLOOR IN THE TRAILER. BOX WAS WET ON BOTTOM CORNER. NO LIQUID ON THE FLOOR NO NEED FOR ZEP ZORBENT. RESPONDER PLACED THE BOX IN A GREEN PLASTIC DMP BAG AND REMOVED IT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING.
